bibl.title: Letter from P.M. Hamer to Philip Showalter Hench, May 21, 1941

div1.p: Hamer replies to Hench's request for an estimate of the cost of reproduction of documents relating to Walter Reed and the study of Yellow Fever.

div1.head: Letter from P.M. Hamer to Philip Showalter Hench, May 21, 1941
div1.opener:
THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES OF THE UNITED STATES
1934
DIVISION OF REFERENCE
The National Archives
Washington, D. C.
MAY 21 1941
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
My dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
This is in reply to your personal request of
April 9 for an estimate of the cost of reproduction of
certain documents relating to Walter Reed and the
study of Yellow Fever.

Negative photostats of the material on Walter
Reed and the Columbia Barracks reservation can be fur-
nished for $3.20. The cost of 8 x 10 inch glossy print
photographs of Walter Reed's oath of office and of the
letter recommending the appointment of a board to study
infectious diseases is $3.75. A photograph of the in-
dorsement on the back of the letter, which indicated
The Adjutant General's approval, can be furnished for
$1.25. The cost of microfilm copies of the material
selected by you for such reproduction, exclusive of
the Medical History of Camp Columbia, is one dollar.
A microfilm copy of the Medical History can be furnished
for $3.15. The cost of microfilming pages 1, and 19
through 59, alone, is $1.50.

If you wish to order any or all of these
copies, please forward to this office your remittance by
certified check or money order made payable to the
Treasurer of the United States.
div1.closer:
Yours very truly, P. M. HAMER, Chief
